result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony P Gausmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 24 mo.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $318  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with bars, taverns and liquor stores. No alcohol in home.
Continued AODA treatment.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Credit does NOT apply.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony P Gausmann

Defendant in court with Attorney Stephen Jay Eisenberg.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  - Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle except for purposes of employment and AODA treatment purposes - provided he has a valid occupational license.
  - The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $10,000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  - Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle except for purposes of employment and provided he has a valid occupational license.
  - The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $10,000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.

Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
